|if_bus_version = |ifconnector = |formfactor = (half) |vendor_id = 168c |device_id = 002a |subvendor_id = 103c |subdevice_id = 3041 |id_string = |windosid = |fcc_id = PPD-AR5BHB92-H, PPD-AR5BHB92 |icid = 4104A-AR5BHB92H |boardid = |ecc_id = |oui = 00:22:5F, 1C:65:9D, 68:A3:C4, 70:1A:04, 70:F1:A1 |chip1 = Atheros;AR9280; |chip2 = |chip3 = |chip4 = |antconn = U.FL |antenna = |txchains = 2 |rxchains = 2 |sstreams = 2 |wirelessstand = IEEE 802.11a/b/g/n |802.11n = 300/300 |802.11g = 54 |802.11b = 11 |802.11a = 54 |wififreq = 2.4 or 5 |receive_sens = |transmit_power = |linuxdriv = |windriv = |is_manuf = No |manuf = |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |addchip = |flags = |802dot11_protocols = abgn |accessible_UART = No |accessible_JTAG = |category = |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 09/24/2008 |estreldate = |estprice = |upc = |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = B009PX111U |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = China |powledcolor = |connactled = |spdledcolor = |leddupcolor = |dimmin = |weight = }}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== This module would appear to have the following '''HP''' part numbers.. *P/N: {{HP PN|495848-001}}, SPS# {{HP PN|518437-001;SPS;}} **{{TagLine|802.11A/B/G/N WLAN HF minicard (MD2020)}} **''Most of World implementation'' (FCC) *P/N: {{HP PN|495848-002}}, SPS# {{HP PN|518437-002;SPS;}} **{{TagLine|802.11abgn WLAN HFminicard 2x2 MD ROW}} **''Rest of World implementation'' (non-FCC) *P/N: {{HP PN|495848-003}}, SPS# {{HP PN|580102-001;SPS;}} **{{TagLine|802.11A/B/G/N WLAN HLFre minicard (MD20)}} **has an FCC region regulatory label **seems to have been used in some DV6Z series notebooks The following seems to be silkscreened on various cards.. *"WN6502AH-H1 V01" and "323C16157197" (both on the back and covered by the reg. label, see below pictures) on V1 units (which look to include at least some, if not all, HP 495848-001 and 495848-002 cards) *"WN6502AH-H1 V03" and "323C1615739D" (both on the front by the mPCIe connector edge, uncovered) on V3 units (which look to include at least some, if not all, HP 495848-003 cards) The FCC ID of this device appears to be PPD-AR5BHB92-H.. which has a change of identification to PPD-AR5BHB92. ===Noted cards=== *HP '''495848-001''' (the below lspci / ath9k info dumps are per a card of this type) **OUIs: 00:22:5F, 70:1A:04, 70:F1:A1 *HP '''495848-003''' **OUIs: 70:1A:04 ===lspci -nnv dump=== 
04:00.0 Network controller [0280]: Atheros Communications Inc. AR928X Wireless Network Adapter (PCI-Express) [168c:002a] (rev 01)
        Subsystem: Hewlett-Packard Company AR5BHB92-H 802.11abgn Wireless Half-size Mini PCIe Card [AR9280] [103c:3041]
        Physical Slot: 0
        Flags: bus master, fast devsel, latency 0, IRQ 17
        Memory at f0100000 (64-bit, non-prefetchable) [size=64K]
        Capabilities: [40] Power Management version 2
        Capabilities: [50] MSI: Enable- Count=1/1 Maskable- 64bit-
        Capabilities: [60] Express Legacy Endpoint, MSI 00
        Capabilities: [90] MSI-X: Enable- Count=1 Masked-
        Capabilities: [100] Advanced Error Reporting
        Capabilities: [140] Virtual Channel
        Capabilities: [160] Device Serial Number 00-00-00-00-00-00-00-00
        Kernel driver in use: ath9k
        Kernel modules: ath9k
===ath9k info dump=== 
ath: EEPROM regdomain: 0x69
ath: EEPROM indicates we should expect a direct regpair map
ath: Country alpha2 being used: 00
ath: Regpair used: 0x69
ieee80211 phy46: Selected rate control algorithm 'ath9k_rate_control'
ieee80211 phy46: Atheros AR9280 Rev:2 mem=0xffffc90002ec0000, irq=17
